meanings.definition: A first-year student, especially in high school or college.
meanings.sent1: The frosh was excited to start their new journey in high school.
meanings.sent2: The frosh attended orientation to learn about campus life.
meanings.sent3: The frosh accidentally walked into the wrong classroom on the first day.
meanings.sent4: The frosh was like a fresh bud, ready to bloom in the academic garden.
meanings.sent5: The frosh's enthusiasm for learning was contagious among their peers.

meanings.definition: The act of being a first-year student.
meanings.sent1: Participating in frosh activities helped the new students bond.
meanings.sent2: The frosh of the school year were eager to make new friends.
meanings.sent3: The frosh event included games and icebreakers to welcome everyone.
meanings.sent4: The frosh experience was both nerve-wracking and exhilarating.
meanings.sent5: The froshness of the beginning of the school year brought a sense of renewal.

meanings.definition: A social event or orientation program for first-year students.
meanings.sent1: The frosh was a fun-filled day of games and introductions.
meanings.sent2: Attending the frosh helped the new students feel more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The frosh committee worked hard to organize a memorable event.
meanings.sent4: The frosh was a bridge connecting new students to campus life.
meanings.sent5: The frosh left a lasting impression on the incoming students.
